### Description

In the default `apex_ls` configuration there is this part that calls `java` from `PATH`. This should respect the `JAVA_HOME` environment variable.

https://github.com/neovim/nvim-lspconfig/blob/cab7233cd6a89ec952dfd40c4b74341b1165830e/lua/lspconfig/server_configurations/apex_ls.lua#L9-L12

I searched for other LSPs that seem to use Java and I found this, if it helps.

https://github.com/neovim/nvim-lspconfig/blob/cab7233cd6a89ec952dfd40c4b74341b1165830e/lua/lspconfig/server_configurations/vdmj.lua#L51

### Neovim version

NVIM v0.9.2
Build type: Release
LuaJIT 2.1.1694285958

### Nvim-lspconfig version

_No response_

### Operating system and version

Arch Linux

### Affected language servers

apex_ls

### Steps to reproduce

- Configure `apex_ls` using the provided example
- Install Java 8 and Java 11
- Set Java 8 as default in `PATH` (jorje requires Java 11)
- Run `JAVA_HOME="/path/to/java11" nvim`

### Actual behavior

After `apex_ls` tries to start `jorje` tries to use Java 8 and fails with the following message:
> Client 1 quit with exit code 1 and signal 0

However, it runs fine if the `PATH` is changed to point to Java 11.

### Expected behavior

The `apex_ls` should use Java version provided by the `JAVA_HOME` variable.

### Minimal config

```Lua
require'lspconfig'.apex_ls.setup {
  apex_jar_path = '/path/to/apex-jorje-lsp.jar',
  apex_enable_semantic_errors = false,
  apex_enable_completion_statistics = false,on code completion usage
}
```
